meanings.definition: A person or thing that clumps together in a group or cluster.
meanings.sent1: The clumpers stood together at the bus stop.
meanings.sent2: The clumpers of trees provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The clumpers of friends giggled loudly in the park.
meanings.sent4: The clumpers of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The clumpers of colorful balloons floated in the air.

meanings.definition: A group or cluster of people or things that are close together.
meanings.sent1: We saw a clumpers of birds on the wire.
meanings.sent2: The clumpers of houses made the neighborhood cozy.
meanings.sent3: The clumpers of books on the shelf looked organized.
meanings.sent4: The clumpers of clouds in the sky blocked the sun.
meanings.sent5: The clumpers of flowers in the garden smelled sweet.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into a clump or cluster.
meanings.sent1: She clumpers the toys into a pile.
meanings.sent2: The kids clumpers around the teacher for storytime.
meanings.sent3: The students clumpers together to discuss the project.
meanings.sent4: The ants clumpers around the sugar cube.
meanings.sent5: The rain clumpers on the window pane.
